item.description:
Hello Fellow Portuguese Meet-Uppers,

Last June, I led my very first Portuguese Meet-Up at Ryles to watch and listen to Samba Tremeterra. It was so much fun and I received so much positive feed-back so I decided that I would like to do it all over again.

Sorry for the short notice. I just got back from vacation and learned about the schedule.

"Samba Tremeterra" translated into English would mean something like "earth-shaking samba". Samba Tremeterra is an Afro-Brazilian music and dance group, and their shows are really fun and high energy with a carnival feel. I hope that some of you will come and help us shake the earth.

This event is more intended for the enjoyment of a cultural event than practicing the Portuguese language since this event will take place at a noisy bar/club.

People are welcome and encouraged to practice their Portuguese, however I just wanted to warn you that this event may frustrate people whose main intention is to practice Portuguese. This is not a formal Portuguese language practicing session, regardless there will be a lot of Portuguese speakers available and it will be a lot of fun.

To learn more about Samba TremeTerra visit the following web sites:

http://www.rylesjazz....
http://www.capoeira-a...
*******************************

Also, do not forget, there is a $10 cover charge.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me or a "Portuguese Meet-Up" sign at one of tables close to the stage.

group.name: The Boston/Cambridge Portuguese Language Meetup Group

item.name: Tremeterra at Ryles
